definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: The criminal personality plays an important role in severely violent crimes.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪人格在嚴重暴力犯罪中起着重要作用。

sentences.english: Poor bachelors are often victims of violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 貧窮的單身漢常常是暴力犯罪的受害者。

sentences.english: Violent crimes are especially rambunctious in under-developed areas.
sentences.chinese: 在貧困地區，暴力犯罪尤其猖獗。

sentences.english: There's a violent crime at 32-second intervals in this country.
sentences.chinese: 在該國每32秒鐘就有一件暴力犯罪發生。

sentences.english: Violent crime and corruption are also off the charts.
sentences.chinese: 而暴力犯罪及腐敗行爲更是罄竹難書。

sentences.english: No evidence of previous violent crime by either party.
sentences.chinese: 而且兩人都不曾有過暴力犯罪的前科。

sentences.english: Violent crime is only one of the maladies afflicting modern society.
sentences.chinese: 暴力犯罪僅危害現代社會的弊病之一。

sentences.english: The resulting problem of unsupervised youth is clearly reflected in the time-of-day patterns of juvenile violence.
sentences.chinese: 無人監護的青少年成爲青少年暴力犯罪的典型代表。

sentences.english: Death penalty is a deterrent to violent crimes.
sentences.chinese: 死刑是對暴力犯罪的一種震懾力。
